line_1: Perhaps it was plain to foresee,
line_2: By a swain more engaging than me.

line_1: Alas, Alas! I plainly, friend, foresee
line_2: In points like these we never shall agree.

line_1: None can the Turns of Providence foresee,
line_2: Or what their own Catastrophe may be;

line_1: And maugre all the Dangers I foresee:
line_2: Be Mine this Night, I'll set your Husband free
Tho' they yield in same to thee.

line_1: With wondrous art it can foresee
line_2: What never was, nor e'er can be:
The anxious parent said. – Alas! could we,

line_1: Who blind could ev'ry thing foresee,
So some poor maniac can foresee
line_2: He mourns the fates' severe decree,
